39173105.review:
Completed 28 levels so far, I love this game.

This puzzle game is very easy to learn but hard to master.  It takes no time at all to complete the first few tutorial challenges and quickly educates you as to the game mechanics.  Its very simple actualy, you move a dot from one location to another using various modules that each have their own task.  You are given a limited number of these modules and you have to think creatively to solve the more advanced puzzles.  The music is very relaxing and does not distract your thought process.  My only complaint about this game is the sound made when a module moves something, its a bit of a screech sound almost iritating like scratching fingers on a chalk board but not nearly that bad.  You get used to it and eventualy learn to ignore it, its only a personal preference.  Others may find the sounds soothing.

Pros:

Easy to exit (esc) gets me out in a second, no fiddling with menus making it easy for those who have other daily life duties that  strike at any moment (right now things)

Easy to learn how to play, very short yet well made tutorial that quickly gets to the point and gets you in the game.

Soothing music that is easy to relax to, gives you room for thought.

Price is very reasonable (currently just under $3 cdn)

Cons:
Somewhat iritating screech noise made by modules moving stuff

Possibly short (has not been confirmed, Im on my 28th puzzle, does not look like too many left, is that the end of it or is there more past this point?  I bought this yesterday but didnt expect me to have completed so much of this at this stage.  Keep in mind, ive not finished the game so there verywell could be alot more to be done.  

Id recomend this game for someone who enjoys problem solving and creative thinking and wants a game they can use to exercise their brain, but is quick to put back in the drawer (exit) and continue doing other life stuff.

Just noticed this is available on android so I will be supporting the developer by purchasing for that platform as well.  Would not have known about this game if I had not come across it searching for games on steam.  Glad I did.

Regrets? None.  Definately worth every cent.

38898981.review: Something of a hidden gem for fans of Zachtronics puzzle games such as SpaceChem. This one, however, seems to have rigidly defined puzzles, i.e. you need to find the one and only correct solution for each one. This is opposite to SpaceChem where the playing field is open and the same goal can be achieved in an almost infinite number of ways. [the Sequence] does have its own mechanics to make it different from the rest of the games like it: you can not only move the "binary data point", but also the instructions that move it! So the playing field is quite dynamic. Anyway, the game seems to be well worth the asking price, and especially the sale price.

34034182.review:
謎の白い光の玉を目的地まで運ぶパズルゲーム。

回転や押し出しなどを行うブロックが与えられるので、上手く配置して4回運搬に成功すればクリア。ただし与えられるブロックには限りがあるため、解は基本的に一つである。問題数は48+24（サンドボックスを除く）であり、特に後半の24題は難易度が高い。ちなみに私は全てノーヒントでクリアできた（どやぁ）……もっともブロックの置き方はある程度限られるので、時間かけて試行錯誤すれば自ずと分かるはず。中にはよくこんな問題思いついたなと感心するパズルもあって非常に面白い。コツは各ブロックの周期と処理の順序を理解することだと思う。

ゲーム本編は素晴らしいのだが、エンディングの後操作不能になったり、UIが微妙に不便だったり、実績が無かったり色々足りない部分はあると感じた。

33807917.review:

自己设计路线将目标物运送到目标地点

所以增加了难度 不过解法也受到了极大限制

基础48关后面有不限制使用的关卡

33479871.review: A lot of the puzzles were fun to solve, but unfortunately the game ends just as it starts getting challenging. But for how cheap it is, it's hard to complain. If you like games like SpaceChem I think you'll like this too. Give it a try.

33400451.review:
Not too hard and not too easy.
Had enough content to keep me entertained for a few hours.

If you are looking for a puzzle game with 5-10hours of content this game is worth the $2 price.

32720439.review:
以前iOSでプレイした[url=http://www.engineering.com/GamesPuzzles/ElectricBox.aspx]Electric Box[/url]を思い出しました。
(リンク先で普通にブラウザで遊べます。どちらかが好きならもう片方も楽しめると思う)

ジェネレーターから生み出されるエネルギーの粒？を、各種パーツを使ってゴールまで運搬するパズルゲーム。
他の方も書いていますが、パーツは毎回最低限のものしか与えられないため組み立ての自由度はなく、基本的にはたったひとつの解を探して試行錯誤する。
しかし自分としてはその点はマイナスには感じず、シミュレーションでなくパズルとして楽しめばいいと思いました。

衝突注意、厳密な動作順設定、成功判定はループで、などの点は[url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/92800/SpaceChem/]SpaceChem[/url]を小粒にまとめた感じのプレイ感。あっちも面白いので、この手の電子操作系パズル好きは要チェック！

途中から結構難しくなるものの、じっくり考え、試行錯誤を繰り返せば時間はかかっても解けないことはないと思う。値段も安いし充分遊べます。脳内でパーツを順番に動かしてシミュレーションしながら回路を組むのは頭の体操にとっても良さそうで普通にオススメ。

ゲーム自体は好きなんですが[u]実績に対応してない[/u]点だけが個人的に残念。コミュニティスレッドを覗いてみても、リリース直後から実績対応の要望は出ていますが1年以上経っても実装されていないので、望みは薄でしょう。

32679233.review:
Fun, challeging, cheap.
Just a perfect little game (not that it is easy) for its price.

32327724.review: Good and Simple Design and art.

32129566.review:
Gameplay: Placing and configuring little modules to move a dot from one point to the other. Very programming-like.

Content: The modules cover all of the bases: moving in a line, rotating, turning on and off, changing directions... I wouldn't be surprised if this was a complete enough language to simulate a computer given enough modules and a big enough playing field.

Interface Design: It's a little cumbersome to drag things into place, then click on them to configure them, then click on buttons to rotate or change the polarity. I also found a bug where if you press Esc during a simulation and come back to the level, the level stays as it was during the simulation instead of resetting to how you placed them. I also found there wasn't enough difference between the three simulation speeds.

Sounds: Pretty simple atmospheric music and subtle, not too tiring SFX.

Visuals: Nice clean minimalistic look, the module symbols are pretty good at visually representing what they do.

Style: What I love about this game is that it teaches you to use modules in a "dirty hack" kind of way, creating delays in order to make everything work together in synchronicity. There are also times when you have to use synergy between two modules placed a certain way. Made me have quite a few "Ah-ha!" moments and I felt pretty clever!

Annoyances: All the things I mentionned in Interface Design, probably a syndrome of being a mobile port. Nothing deal-breaking though.

Value: Very fairly priced game, though there's a limit to the premade puzzles it's a very well put together programmy puzzler!

Replayability: A little bit with the Sandbox mode but it's a fairly short game (I'm halfway through as of writing this)... unless you get stuck I suppose, which could still happen to me!

30295237.review: FINALLY! A puzzle game that isn't patronizing or just trial and error. Perfect difficulty curve. I can tell that you spent a lot of time watching other people play your designs (actual playtesting). Absolute props to the dev!
